critique: The document primarily focuses on establishing a wildlife refuge. The tone is formal and legalistic, aiming to convey a sense of authority and commitment to conservation. The primary emotions the President likely wants to elicit are joy (at the preservation of wildlife), and perhaps a touch of surprise (at the scale of the reservation). There might be a slight element of sadness addressed, related to the potential loss of wildlife if no action were taken. Fear and disgust are unlikely to be relevant in this context, and anger is not applicable.
